summary: This is an FBI internal routing document from the Miami Division to the Sacramento office, dated May 25, 2010. It concerns an obstruction of justice investigation against Alfredo Rodriguez, Jeffrey Epstein's former house manager. The document details Rodriguez's possession and attempted sale of an address book believed to contain names of underage victims, and requests assistance from Sacramento to obtain California driver's license information for individuals listed in the book.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Subject of obstruction of justice investigation
persons.context: Former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein. He came into possession of an address book with names and phone numbers believed to be of underage girls and attempted to sell it in November 2009.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Accused individual, former subject of child prostitution investigation
persons.context: Palm Beach County, Florida resident. Former subject of a child prostitution investigation beginning in 2006. He entered into a non-prosecution agreement and pled guilty to lesser offenses in Florida state court.

connections.description: Rodriguez was a house manager and butler employed by Epstein in 2005.
Rodriguez possessed and failed to turn over evidence (an address book) related to Epstein's alleged crimes, and later attempted to sell it.

events.title: Start of Epstein child prostitution investigation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein became the subject of a child prostitution investigation.

events.title: Rodriguez's employment with Epstein ends
events.description: Alfredo Rodriguez's employment as Epstein's house manager and butler ended. He retained an address book belonging to Epstein.

events.title: Miami Division opens obstruction case against Rodriguez
events.description: The FBI's Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez.

events.title: Rodriguez attempts to sell address book
events.description: Alfredo Rodriguez attempted to sell the address book to an undercover employee (UCE) posing as an employee of a plaintiff's attorney suing Epstein.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, Epstein's former house manager, was under FBI investigation for obstruction of justice for possessing and attempting to sell an address book believed to contain names and numbers of underage girls.
The address book was retained by Rodriguez after his employment ended in 2005 and was not turned over to law enforcement during the Epstein investigation.
The FBI believed the address book might contain underage victims from jurisdictions outside the Southern District of Florida, which was covered by Epstein's non-prosecution agreement.
Rodriguez attempted to sell the book in November 2009 to an undercover employee posing as working for a plaintiff's attorney suing Epstein.
The document is an FBI request for the Sacramento office to obtain California driver's license information for individuals listed under a section labeled 'California Massage' in the address book.
